title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Generates nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals (Efron & Tibshirani, 1993: https://doi.org/10.1201/9780429246593) standardized regression coefficients (beta) effect sizes, including multiple correlation, semipartial correlations, improvement R-squared, squared partial correlations, differences standardized regression coefficients, models fitted lm().

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: can install CRAN release betaNB : can install development version betaNB GitHub :

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA [@NationalResearchCouncil-1982]. Confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaNB() function betaNB package.

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Fit regression model using lm() function.
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: BetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0718 5000 0.3541 0.6390 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0768 5000 0.2350 0.5349 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0797 5000 0.0986 0.4104

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: betaNB package also functions generate nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals effect sizes RSqNB() multiple correlation coefficients (R-squared adjusted R-squared), DeltaRSqNB() improvement R-squared, SCorNB() semipartial correlation coefficients, PCorNB() squared partial correlation coefficients, DiffBetaNB() differences standardized regression coefficients.

what: Multiple Correlation Coefficients (R-squared and adjusted R-squared)
title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: RSqNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> RSqNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> R-squared and adjusted R-squared #> type = "pc" #>        est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> rsq 0.8045 0.0522 5000 0.6966 0.8994 #> adj 0.7906 0.0559 5000 0.6750 0.8922

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: DeltaRSqNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> DeltaRSqNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Improvement in R-squared #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.1859 0.0592 5000 0.0804 0.3143 #> PCTGRT  0.1177 0.0485 5000 0.0353 0.2216 #> PCTSUPP 0.0569 0.0337 5000 0.0077 0.1336

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: SCorNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> SCorNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Semipartial correlations #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4312 0.0695 5000 0.2835 0.5606 #> PCTGRT  0.3430 0.0728 5000 0.1878 0.4707 #> PCTSUPP 0.2385 0.0716 5000 0.0879 0.3654

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: PCorNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> PCorNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Squared partial correlations #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R  2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4874 0.0994 5000 0.281 0.6699 #> PCTGRT  0.3757 0.1089 5000 0.159 0.5877 #> PCTSUPP 0.2254 0.1151 5000 0.040 0.4769

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Differences of standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1311 5000 -0.1437 0.3710 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1240 5000 -0.0070 0.4873 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1281 5000 -0.1189 0.3814

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: See GitHub Pages package documentation.

text: Fit regression model using lm() function.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Pesigan, . J. . (2022). Confidence intervals standardized coefficients: Applied regression coefficients primary studies indirect effects meta-analytic structural equation modeling [Unpublished doctoral dissertation]. University Macau. Pesigan, . J. . (2023). betaNB: Bootstrap Regression Effect Sizes. . https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=betaNB
code: @PhdThesis{,   author = {Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan},   title = {Confidence intervals for standardized coefficients: Applied to regression coefficients in primary studies and indirect effects in meta-analytic structural equation modeling},   year = {2022},   school = {University of Macau}, } @Manual{,   author = {Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan},   title = {betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes},   year = {2023}, }

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan 2025-07-22

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Generates nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals (Efron & Tibshirani, 1993: https://doi.org/10.1201/9780429246593) standardized regression coefficients (beta) effect sizes, including multiple correlation, semipartial correlations, improvement R-squared, squared partial correlations, differences standardized regression coefficients, models fitted lm().

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: can install CRAN release betaNB : can install development version betaNB GitHub :

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: example, multiple regression model fitted using program quality ratings (QUALITY) regressand/outcome variable number published articles attributed program faculty members (NARTIC), percent faculty members holding research grants (PCTGRT), percentage program graduates received support (PCTSUPP) regressor/predictor variables using data set 1982 ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA (National Research Council, 1982). Confidence intervals standardized regression coefficients generated using BetaNB() function betaNB package.

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: Fit regression model using lm() function.
code: object <- lm(QUALITY ~ NARTIC + PCTGRT + PCTSUPP, data = df)

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: BetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> BetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4951 0.0727 5000 0.3544 0.6366 #> PCTGRT  0.3915 0.0765 5000 0.2360 0.5361 #> PCTSUPP 0.2632 0.0788 5000 0.1099 0.4153

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: betaNB package also functions generate nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals effect sizes RSqNB() multiple correlation coefficients (R-squared adjusted R-squared), DeltaRSqNB() improvement R-squared, SCorNB() semipartial correlation coefficients, PCorNB() squared partial correlation coefficients, DiffBetaNB() differences standardized regression coefficients.

what: Multiple Correlation Coefficients (R-squared and adjusted R-squared)
title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: RSqNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> RSqNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> R-squared and adjusted R-squared #> type = "pc" #>        est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> rsq 0.8045 0.0520 5000 0.6938 0.8985 #> adj 0.7906 0.0557 5000 0.6720 0.8913

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: DeltaRSqNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> DeltaRSqNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Improvement in R-squared #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.1859 0.0595 5000 0.0806 0.3139 #> PCTGRT  0.1177 0.0488 5000 0.0357 0.2254 #> PCTSUPP 0.0569 0.0337 5000 0.0097 0.1375

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: SCorNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> SCorNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Semipartial correlations #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4312 0.0700 5000 0.2839 0.5603 #> PCTGRT  0.3430 0.0729 5000 0.1888 0.4748 #> PCTSUPP 0.2385 0.0705 5000 0.0987 0.3708

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: PCorNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> PCorNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Squared partial correlations #> type = "pc" #>            est     se    R   2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC  0.4874 0.0998 5000 0.2880 0.6761 #> PCTGRT  0.3757 0.1089 5000 0.1593 0.5833 #> PCTSUPP 0.2254 0.1148 5000 0.0466 0.4751

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
code: DiffBetaNB(nb, alpha = 0.05) #> Call: #> DiffBetaNB(object = nb, alpha = 0.05) #>  #> Differences of standardized regression slopes #> type = "pc" #>                   est     se    R    2.5%  97.5% #> NARTIC-PCTGRT  0.1037 0.1319 5000 -0.1527 0.3734 #> NARTIC-PCTSUPP 0.2319 0.1243 5000 -0.0137 0.4755 #> PCTGRT-PCTSUPP 0.1282 0.1262 5000 -0.1109 0.3766

title: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes
text: See GitHub Pages package documentation.

Estimate Standardized Regression Coefficients and Generate the Corresponding Sampling Distribution Using Nonparametric Bootstrapping — BetaNB
text: object Object class nb, , output NB() function. alpha Numeric vector. Significance level \(\alpha\).

title: Estimate Standardized Regression Coefficients and Generate the Corresponding Sampling Distribution Using Nonparametric Bootstrapping — BetaNB
text: Returns object class betanb list following elements: call Function call. args Function arguments. thetahatstar Sampling distribution \(\boldsymbol{\hat{\beta}}\). jackknife Jackknife estimates. vcov Sampling variance-covariance matrix \(\boldsymbol{\hat{\beta}}\). est Vector estimated \(\boldsymbol{\hat{\beta}}\). fun Function used ("BetaNB").

title: Estimate Standardized Regression Coefficients and Generate the Corresponding Sampling Distribution Using Nonparametric Bootstrapping — BetaNB
text: vector standardized regression coefficients (\(\boldsymbol{\hat{\beta}}\)) estimated bootstrap samples. Confidence intervals generated obtaining percentiles corresponding \(100(1 - \alpha)\%\) generated sampling distribution \(\boldsymbol{\hat{\beta}}\), \(\alpha\) significance level.

title: Estimate Multiple Correlation Coefficients (R-Squared and Adjusted R-Squared) and Generate the Corresponding Sampling Distribution Using Nonparametric Bootstrapping — RSqNB
text: Returns object class betanb list following elements: call Function call. args Function arguments. thetahatstar Sampling distribution \(R^{2}\) \(\bar{R}^{2}\). vcov Sampling variance-covariance matrix \(R^{2}\) \(\bar{R}^{2}\). est Vector estimated \(R^{2}\) \(\bar{R}^{2}\). fun Function used ("RSqNB").

title: Estimate Multiple Correlation Coefficients (R-Squared and Adjusted R-Squared) and Generate the Corresponding Sampling Distribution Using Nonparametric Bootstrapping — RSqNB
text: R-squared (\(R^{2}\)) adjusted R-squared (\(\bar{R}^{2}\)) estimated bootstrap samples. Confidence intervals generated obtaining percentiles corresponding \(100(1 - \alpha)\%\) generated sampling distribution \(R^{2}\) \(\bar{R}^{2}\), \(\alpha\) significance level.

what: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes — betaNB-package
title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes — betaNB-package
text: Generates nonparametric bootstrap confidence intervals (Efron Tibshirani, 1993: doi:10.1201/9780429246593 ) standardized regression coefficients (beta) effect sizes, including multiple correlation, semipartial correlations, improvement R-squared, squared partial correlations, differences standardized regression coefficients, models fitted lm().

title: betaNB: Bootstrap for Regression Effect Sizes — betaNB-package
text: Maintainer: Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan r.jeksterslab@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

1982 National Academy of Sciences Doctoral Programs Data — nas1982
text: Ratings 46 doctoral programs psychology USA following variables: QUALITY Program quality ratings. NFACUL Number faculty members program. NGRADS Number program graduates. PCTSUPP Percentage program graduates received support. PCTGRT Percent faculty members holding research grants. NARTIC Number published articles attributed program faculty member. PCTPUB Percent faculty one published article.
